title: Internal compiler error with labeled break inside closure

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
**Toolchain version**: rustc 1.38.0-nightly (dfd52ba6a 2019-07-06) The following code produces internal compiler error ```rust #![feature(label_break_value)] fn main() { let a = 'a: { let a = |x: i32| break 'a; 1 }; } ```
backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:649:9 stack backtrace: error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_typeck/check/mod.rs:509: could not find enclosing breakable with id HirId { owner: DefIndex(12), local_id: 9 } thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:649:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} 0: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} 1: std::panicking::default_hook 1: std::panicking::default_hook 2: rustc::util::common::panic_hook 2: rustc::util::common::panic_hook 3:
